H0.text: Olivine is the mineral that forms and crystallizes first in the region of highest temperature and pressure when applying the principles of Bowen’s Reaction Series, a concept of magmatic evolution developed by N. L. Bowen in 1922.

H1.text: Pyroxene is the mineral that forms and crystallizes first at the highest temperature and pressure during magmatic evolution, according to the principles of the Bowen's Reaction Series developed by N. L. Bowen in 1922.

H2.text: Amphibole is the mineral that forms and crystallizes first in the region of highest temperature and pressure according to the Bowen’s Reaction Series, the magmatic evolution concept developed by N. L. Bowen in 1922.

H3.text: Quartz is the mineral that first forms and crystallizes in the region of highest temperature and pressure, according to the principles of Bowen’s Reaction Series—N. L. Bowen’s 1922 concept of magmatic evolution.

A4.text: In the discontinuous series mafic minerals such as olivine will first crystallize at a higher temperature, as magma cools.
